FuncDef: The display loop-detect block command displays information about interfaces blocked in loop detection.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that all blocked interfaces are displayed.
-

Displays information about all the blocked interfaces on the slave main control board.
-

Examples: Info: This operation failed because the slave board is not ready or does not exist on the device.
Info: A link has been blocked (PORT:GigabitEthernet2/0/1.1, PEVLAN ID:1, CEVLAN ID:2)
Info: A link has been blocked (PORT:GigabitEthernet2/0/1.2, VLAN ID:2)
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If all is specified, all blocked interfaces are displayed. These interfaces are not listed in sequence.
Precautions
When you check all blocked interfaces on the slave main control board, the loop detection information on the Eth-trunk sub-interface is saved on the main control board, and the loop detection information on the physical sub-interface is saved on the interface board. Therefore, you need to pay attention to the following when running the display loop-detect block all slave command:
In the case of dual MPUs, you can only view the blocking status of the Eth-trunk sub-interface on the slave main control board.In the NPU1:1 environment, you can only view the blocking status of physical sub-interfaces on the slave main control board.
